Levelsystem module¶

Created on Thu May 14 02:03:38 2020

@author: Felix

This module contains all classes and functions to define a System including all Level objects.

Example

Below an empty Levelsystem is created which automatically initializes an instance of the Groundstates and the Excitedstates classes. Within these instances the respective ground states and excited states can be added:

>>> levels = Levelsystem()
>>> levels.grstates.add_grstate(nu=0,N=1)
>>> levels.grstates.add_lossstate(nu=1)
>>> levels.exstates.add_exstate(nu=0,N=0,J=.5,p=+1)

Tip

Every object of Levelsystem or Level class can be printed to display all attributes via:

>>> print(levels)
>>> print(levels.grstates)
>>> print(levels.exstates[0])
